title: Businessman murdered in city
body: A businessman was shot dead allegedly by a youth in the Shyambazar area under Sutrapur police station in the Old Town of Dhaka on Thursday. The victim, Abdur Rahman, 55, is a resident of the area and is a former president of the Shyambazar Kitchen Market Tradersâ€™ Association. The news of the murder of the businessman came a month after the November 10 murder of a murder case accused, Tarek Saif Mamun, in the same style near Dhaka National Medical College Hospital in the same area. The police said that the youth opened fire at Abdur Rahman in front of Maolabox Eye Hospital sometime after 12:00 at noon and fled the scene, leaving the victim in a pool of blood. They said that the pedestrians rescued the businessman and rushed him to Sir Salimullah Medical College Mitford Hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead at about 1:30pm. Sutrapur police station officer-in-charge Matiur Rahman said that they had collected CCTV footage from the area and reviewed it with the help of local people. He, referring to preliminary information from local people, said that the assailant is Nayon. OC Matiur said that they were yet to know the motive behind the murder. He said that they were trying to arrest the assailant.
